definitions.definition: having a strong desire to know about something
definitions.sensetop: curious about somebody/somethingcurious as to somethingcurious to do something

examples.text: He is such a curious boy, always asking questions.
They were very curious about the people who lived upstairs.
Everyone was curious as to why Mark was leaving.
I was curious to find out what she had said.
Her secretive manner had made me curious.
I was curious about how she would react.
I was intensely curious to know more about him.
I'm just curious to know what you think.
She was curious as to why he was there.

phrases: curious to find out, know, see, etc. somebody/​something

examples.text: There was a curious mixture of people in the audience.
It was a curious feeling, as though we were floating on air.
It was curious that she didn't tell anyone.
She ignored the curious looks from passers-by.
I find it very curious that you did not tell anyone.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French curios, from Latin curiosus ‘careful’, from cura ‘care’. Sense (2) dates from the early 18th cent.
